chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime
Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Orlando A Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.075(1r).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
$540.60 fine & costs imposed, to run concurrent with prison sentence.
Submit DNA sample if not already provided.
Comply with Sex Offender Registry.
Not closer the 1000 ft from a school, park or daycare.
Absolute sobriety.
No contact with anyone <18 without Agent approval.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: No factual errors in the PSI.  Parties have reviewed the document.  There is a mandatory minimum of 5 years confinement.  State recommends 10 years (5 + 5), defense recommends 7 years (5 + 2).  Court orders defense recommendation.  Conditions of ES are :  $10 + costs, DNA sample, Sex offender registry, 1000 ft from a school, day care or park, Absolute sobriety, no contact with anyone <18 without Agent approval.  Parties will keep their PSI's.
for Sentencing Hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 2:30pm.

Defendant Orlando A Brown in court with Attorney George Steve Pappas.  Defendant Orlando A Brown in custody.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PQWR form filed by Atty. Pappas Jr. Atty. Parker requests to dismiss the "repeater" on Count 1. Court questions the Def. on said waiver - Orlando Brown verbally pleads No Contest to Count 1 (minus the repeater). Court finds him guilty of Count 1 (minus the repeater). PSI ordered.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Orlando A Brown (i/c) in court with Attorney George Steve Pappas. Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. enters a plea of NG. PTC to be set after a new judge is assigned.

Defendant Orlando A Brown (i/c) in court with Attorney George Steve Pappas. Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Pappas Jr. informs the court his client will proceed with PH waiver/ARGN with the understanding that they filed a Substitution of Judge request.

Defendant Orlando A Brown in court with attorney George Steve Pappas.  Defendant Orlando A Brown in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing requested.  Bond continues with all conditions.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 4, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Orlando A Brown in court, in custody.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Right to counsel given - defendant wishes to speak with an attorney.  Not sure how to do that.  PD advised to go to jail and interview.  Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

No contact with anyone less than 18 years old except if incarcerated.  No travel outside Shawano, Menominee or Brown Counties without prior court approval.  No access or possession of any device that accesses the internet, except he may use computer for educational purposes only, no social medial sites, etc.

Defendant Orlando A Brown appeared by video means with Atty Haacke. Prosecuting Atty Catharine D. White appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
